summary: In Greek mythology, Cerberus is a fierce, three-headed dog with snakes for a tail and body. He guards the Underworld, keeping the dead inside. He was born from the monsters Echidna and Typhon. Heracles, a famous hero, captured Cerberus as his final labor. This scene is often depicted in ancient art, showing Heracles presenting the frightened king Eurystheus with the mighty Cerberus.
title: Cerberus
